answers.answer: Hi there,A complete medical evaluation is necessary for determining the correct cause of your symptoms. The normal range of gamma GT is 0 to 51 international units per liter (IU/L). GGT is usually elevated in liver disease, obstructive lesions of the biliary tree, use of drugs like phenytoin and barbiturates, pancreatic disease, diabetes mellitus, myocardial infarction, alcoholism etc.Though GGT measurement is a sensitive indicator of presence or absence of hepatobiliary disease it is not a very specific test. For diagnosing any condition it has to be correlated with other liver function tests and clinical findings. In alcoholism GGT may be raised and SGOT and SGPT may be slightly or not raised at all. In case you are having any symptoms related to the conditions mentioned above it is best to discuss it with your physician.Take care and good luck!

question: Good day my blood test shows : AST, ALT, ALP and bilirrubin nevels normal but an elevated GAMMA GGT 82 u/l, I drink beer almost daily but ( 3 to 4) , should I be worry?
title: liver tests
